title: The unisex sports bra that claims it can help your swimming
text:
Can you swim? I can, sort of. I know the theory behind all the strokes, but have rarely used them since swimming lessons at school, which put me off the sport for life. It turns out I’m not unusual: one in four Brits say they can’t even swim a 25m pool length, which is a requirement in the primary school curriculum.

But now there is something called the Nova, made by tech company INCUS, which claims it can measure my flailing around and give me tips on how to improve my swimming. “It’s not a tracker, it’s a performance management tool,” says Chris Ruddock, the managing director. He explains that “with a stopwatch you can time a length, but you can’t tell how you got there”.
